charges.charge_description: NARCOTICS - SELL, DISTRIBUTE, OR DISPENSE - Knowingly and intentionally did combine, conspire, agree and have tacit understanding with each  other and with others, both known and unknown to the grand jury, to knowingly, intentionally and  unlawfully possess with intent to distribute and distribute cocaine base (commonly known as "crack"  cocaine), a Schedule II controlled substance, said conspiracy involving 280 grams or more of "crack" cocaine, in violation of Title 21, United States Code, Sections 841 (a)(1) and 841(b)(1)(A); All in violation of Title 21, United States Code, Section 846.(1)

charges.charge_disposition: The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total term of THIRTY (30) months for each count to run concurrently. While incarcerated, the defendant is to pay not more than $25.00 every three (3) months from assets or income deposited into the defendach count, for a total of $400.00. charges.charge_description: ATTEMPT AND CONSPIRACY TO COMMIT MAIL FRAUD - Did devise and intend to devise a scheme and artifice to defraud American Family Home Insurance Company and to obtain money and property from American Family Home Insurance Company by means of false and fraudulent pretenses, representations and promises, including false reports of home burglary to the Colleton County Sheriffs Office and the American Family Home Insurance Company; all in violation of Title 18, United States Code, Section 1349.(6)

charges.charge_description: FRAUD BY WIRE, RADIO, OR TELEVISION - For the purpose of executing the scheme and artifice, knowingly did use and cause the use of   interstate wire transmissions to file a false insurance claim in order to obtain money and property in the form of an insurance settlement from American Family Home Insurance Company; In violation of Title 18, United States Code, Section 1343.(7)

charges.charge_description: FRAUDS AND SWINDLES - For the purpose of executing the above scheme and artifice to defraud, knowingly did cause to be mailed according to the directions thereon, and did take and receive from the mail, settlement checks from American Family Home Insurance Company representing the proceeds of the false insurance claims described herein; In violation of Title 18, United States Code, Section 1341.(8)

charges.charge_description: USE COMMUNICATIONS FACILITY - CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE - DISTRIBUTION:  As principals, aiders and abettors and co-participants in jointly undertaken criminal activity,  knowingly and intentionally did use a communication facility, that is, a telephone, to facilitate the   commission of a felony under the Controlled Substances Act, to wit: conspiracy to distribute, possession with intent to distribute, and distribution of cocaine base (commonly known as "crack" cocaine), a Schedule II controlled substance, in violation of Title 21, United States Code, Sections 841(a)(1) and 846: All in violation of Title 21, United States Code, Section 843(b), 843(d)(1) and Title 18, United States Code, Section 2, aid and abet.(2-5)

charges.charge_disposition: Dismissed on motion of the government.

charges.charge_description: 21:841A=ND.F  Possession with intent to distribute crack cocaine

USE COMMUNICATIONS FACILITY - CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE - DISTRIBUTION:  As principals, aiders and abettors and co-participants in jointly undertaken criminal activity,  knowingly and intentionally did use a communication facility, that is, a telephone, to facilitate the   commission of a felony under the Controlled Substances Act, to wit: conspiracy to distribute, possession with intent to distribute, and distribution of cocaine base (commonly known as "crack" cocaine), a Schedule II controlled substance, in violation of Title 21, United States Code, Sections 841(a)(1) and 846: All in violation of Title 21, United States Code, Section 843(b), 843(d)(1) and Title 18, United States Code, Section 2, aid and abet.(2)

charges.charge_disposition: The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total term of THIRTY SEVEN (37) months. The defendant shall pay a $100.00 special assessment fee, due beginning immediately. The court makes the following recommendations to the Bureau of Prisons: The defendant shall be designated to the federal correctional institute closest to his home in South Carolina. The defendant shall be evaluated for participation in the intensive drug treatment program. The defendant is remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal. Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be on supervised release for a term of ONE (1) year. While on supervised release, the defendant shall comply with the mandatory and standard conditions of supervision outlined in 18 USC ยง 3583(d). The defendant shall also comply with the following special conditions: 1. The defendant shall satisfactorily participate in a substance abuse treatment program, to include drug testing, as approved by the U.S. Probation Office. 2. The defendant shall participate in a Cognitive Behavioral Program as approved by the U.S. Probation Office. The defendant shall not possess a firearm, ammunition, destructive device, or any other dangerous weapon. The defendant shall cooperate in the collection of DNA as directed by the probation officer.

charges.charge_description: NARCOTICS - SELL, DISTRIBUTE, OR DISPENSE - Knowingly and intentionally did combine, conspire, agree and have tacit understanding with each  other and with others, both known and unknown to the grand jury, to knowingly, intentionally and  unlawfully possess with intent to distribute and distribute cocaine base (commonly known as "crack"  cocaine), a Schedule II controlled substance, said conspiracy involving 280 grams or more of "crack" cocaine, in violation of Title 21, United States Code, Sections 841 (a)(1) and 841(b)(1)(A); All in violation of Title 21, United States Code, Section 846.(1)

charges.charge_disposition: Dismissed on motion of the government.

charges.charge_disposition: Dismissed on motion of the government.

charges.charge_disposition: The defendant is hereby sentenced to probation for a term of THREE (3) years. The defendant shall pay a $100.00 special assessment fee, due beginning immediately. While on probation, the defendant shall comply with the mandatory and standard conditions of supervision outlined in 18 U.S.C. ยง 3563(a) &; (b). The defendant shall also comply with the following special conditions: 1. The defendant shall submit to curfew restrictions for a term of 5 months, as approved by the U.S. Probation Officer. 2. The defendant shall participate in a program of testing and treatment for substance abuse as approved by the U.S. Probation Officer until such time as he is released from the program by the probation officer. The defendant shall not possess a firearm, ammunition, destructive device, or any other dangerous weapon. The defendant shall cooperate in the collection of DNA as directed by the probation officer.

charges.charge_disposition: The defendant is hereby sentenced to probation for a term of TWO (2) years. The defendant shall pay a special assessment fee of $100.00, due immediately. While on probation, the defendant shall comply with the standard and mandatory conditions of probation and also with the following special conditions. 1. The defendant shall participate in a Cognitive Behavioral Program as approved by the U.S. Probation Office. 2. The defendant shall participate in a financial or consumer credit program as approved by the U.S. Probation Office. The defendant shall not possess a firearm, ammunition, destructive device, or any other dangerous weapon. The defendant shall cooperate in the collection of DNA as directed by the probation officer.
